body:
Programmers use comments to explain their code's functionality. For instance:
```
# This comment describes the following code:
if foo == bar:
    print "hello world"
```

Be sure to include comments that document your code!
Overall, you're doing a good job instantiating movie objects, just be aware of the line length limit.

Python's style guide, [Pep8](https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0008/), sets a [maximum line length](https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0008/#maximum-line-length) of 80 characters. However, long urls are an exception to this rule. In this case, you should leave the url on a single line and use [the inline comment `# noqa`](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5033727/how-do-i-get-pyflakes-to-ignore-a-statement) at the end of long urls to suppress linter warnings.
